bibl.title: Greek and Roman Symbols Continued on Coptic Textiles.
bibl.note: Introduction. - Greek meaning of the centaur. - Astronomical role of the centaur. - Christian meaning of the centaur. - Classical representations of the centaur. - Coptic textiles with a figure of the centaur. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: with the assistance of Maarten KERSTEN and Carolien VAN ZOEST, Coptic Studies on the Treshold of a New Millennium. Proceedings of the Seventh International Congress of Coptic Studies. Leiden, 27 August - 2 September 2000. II

bibl.seg: LEBET-MINAKOWSKA Anna, Greek and Roman Symbols Continued on Coptic Textiles.

Mat IMMERZEEL and Jacques VAN DER VLIET (Edd.), with the assistance of Maarten KERSTEN and Carolien VAN ZOEST, Coptic Studies on the Treshold of a New Millennium. Proceedings of the Seventh International Congress of Coptic Studies. Leiden, 27 August - 2 September 2000. II = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 133 (Leuven, 2004) pp. 1359-1363.

Introduction. - Greek meaning of the centaur. - Astronomical role of the centaur. - Christian meaning of the centaur. - Classical representations of the centaur. - Coptic textiles with a figure of the centaur. - Conclusion.
